description: This course focuses on screen-based media, from television to fillm, social media platforms to
from theoretical and critical perspectives.  Primary emphasis is on the diverse ways screen media
production, distribution, and consumption inform contemporary issues in the public sphere.  In
particular, the course examines media discourses on identity, agency, and privacy, and how media
representations of race, class, and gender presently exist as both products and producers of
contemporary cultures.  Offered alternate years. Also counts toward management studies
